news.title: Odisha government asks urban bodies to ready disaster management plan
news.para: There have been an increase in natural disasters due to climate change affecting people, infrastructure and assets in urban areas.

news.title: After Punjab & Haryana HC intervention, HSVP allottee hopes to get plot after 30 years
news.para: Bansal was 38 years old when he was allotted the plot in 1992, but he could not get possession of the plot even when he turned 68 years old.

news.title: Kolkata civic body to issue certificates for tenants before razing unsafe buildings
news.para: In an attempt to address the insecurity among a section of tenants living in unsafe buildings across the city, the Kolkata Municipal Corporation has decided to issue certificates recording the names of tenants before the civic body decides to demolish dilapidated buildings on the grounds of public safety.

news.title: Visakhapatnam: Officials directed to install electricity meters in Tidco beneficiaries' name
news.para: The commissioner said bank loans have been sanctioned to 37 beneficiaries in Chilakapeta and 25 beneficiaries in Seahorse Junction.

news.title: Gandhinagar: Township society opposes sewage treatment plant nearby
news.para: The residents complained that the existing STP does not have any discharge outlet and polluted water after treatment is discharged into open fields in violation of pollution control rules.

news.title: Thiruvananthapuram civic body records 88% rise in property tax collection
news.para: In 2021-22, the corporation collected Rs 11 crore in the same time period. The monthly collection from April to July has consistently been above Rs 4 crore. May recorded the highest collection so far in the present fiscal year Rs 6 crore.

news.title: Cuddalore: Four builders directed to pay Rs 1.55 lakh to consumer
news.para: Commission president D Gopinath and members T Kalaiyarasi and V N Parthiban directed the developer to pay Rs 50,000 as compensation for causing mental agony, pain and suffering to the complainant and Rs 5,000 as litigation cost.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body yet to take action on Rs 1.17 lakh illegal constructions
news.para: In 2012, just ahead of the state assembly elections, the AMC had begun the process of regularizing buildings under the Gujarat Regularization of Unauthorized Development Act, 2011, (GRUD Act) after charging an ‘impact fee’.

news.title: Indore civic body identifies two lakh structures with irregularities
news.para: Of these, 1 lakh properties were found to have not been registered in IMC’s record, 39,267 properties have difference in their registered size or construction area that ranges from 2000 sq ft to 5000 sq ft, and 21,571 residential properties were found being used for commercial purposes, said officials.

news.title: IBBI likely to issue more regulations by August-end to streamline CIRP
news.para: ​The new set of regulations will aim at further streamlining the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC).

news.title: CapitaLand developing 2.6 million sq ft IT Park in Chennai
news.para: To be developed in two phases of 1.3 million sq ft each, the first phase will be ready by the end of March, 2023 and the second by December, 2024.

news.title: Eight lakh property registrations in Maharashtra in four months
news.para: Developers expect the trend to continue during the festive period till November. "The real estate sector is back to the pre-pandemic levels - both in terms of registrations and revenue," a registration department official said.

news.title: Illegal colonies outside Gurugram civic body limits will be regularised
news.para: Recently, a survey was conducted to assess the status of basic amenities in these unauthorised colonies. According to the records, there are around 500 illegal colonies in and around the city.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Sheetal Infrastructure buys SG Road plot for Rs 118 crore
news.para: Sheetal Infrastructure CMD Paras Pandit said: "We have initiated the deal to buy about 17,500 sq yard plot near Vaishnodevi Circle and it will be complete soon."

news.title: Gurugram: Five flats built illegally at Aloha's stilt area razed
news.para: At present, around 250 families reside in Aloha, which was built on 4.4 acres by AEZ Infratech in 2005. The project was supposed to be delivered in 2008-09 but the developer started giving possession only from 2013 and that too without procuring the mandatory OC.
